Author: LocoMB#8593
Content:
Dudes! I have a small hitch building Komodo-ocean-Qt on my brand new Ubuntu 19.04:
'checking for exit in -lboost_system-mt...no
configure: error: Could not link against boost_system-mt ! '

However, on the same machine the latest pirate-qt-linux built just fine, so I guess tis is not a big thing
apitude says I have boost 1.65 and 1.67 - do you have a hint for me, @Decker @ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢 ??

Author: LocoMB#8593
Content: there was similar stuff discussed on zcash issues some time back, but there are no conclusive answers- some say add some compiler directive - but no defintive resolution..

Author: gigamesh#3544
Content: https://twitter.com/alexlibertas_/status/1180090215710543872

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
Other than the `cd komodo` needing to be changed to `cd KomodoOcean`,
<https://github.com/DeckerSU/KomodoOcean/tree/static#linux>
builds on a fresh Ubuntu 19.04 vm as expected for me*

*you may need to change
```elif test x$TARGET_OS != xwindows; then
  LIBZCASH_LIBS="-lgmp -lgmpxx -lboost_system -lcrypto -lsodium $RUST_LIBS"```
to
```elif test x$TARGET_OS != xwindows; then
  LIBZCASH_LIBS="-lgmp -lgmpxx -lboost_system-mt -lcrypto -lsodium $RUST_LIBS"```
in configure.ac if you get
`/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lboost_system`
